result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution set at $2,093.48 payable to Adwell Partners and American Family Insurance.  Restitution to be paid before court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  
*1/10/2017  amended, the $2,093.48  payable to Adwil Partners.

Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job. Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 1/10/2017, the $2,093.48 restitution payable to Adwil Partners.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed on January 9, 2017. Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections. File back to closing to amend JOC. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[ X ]   Restitution Determination (DOC-31, DOC-37)
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations

Defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 99 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:

-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $2,093.48 payable to Adwell Partners and American Family Insurance.  Restitution to be paid before court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jones just appointed.  Attorney needs additional time to speak with his client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells not in court, defendant in custody.   Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance from defense counsel.  Email submitted to Public Defenders Office on 7/15/15 indicating counsel needs to be appointed.  Since no appearance this date, another email submitted to Public Defenders Office to have someone appointed and matter rescheduled.  Return on warrant scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
The court ordered any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells not in court.  
Michael Jerome Lonski for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference at 8:30 a.m.  Attorney Brian Hagner appeared, defendant failed to appear.  Defendant given time to appear; case passed until 1:30 p.m.  Case called at approximately 2:30 p.m.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense, signed and filed.

Defendant Robert John James Marshall-Wells in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Colloquy held with the defendant as to earnings and expenses.  Based upon review of the defendant's financial circumstances and statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense.  Defendant to provide tax return documents on the next date set in Branch 21.  The Court appoints Attorney Brian Hagner to represent defendant.  Defendant agrees to repay attorney fees. Court ordered defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $100.00 per month while this case is pending.  The first payment is due 5-01-15 and on the 1st of every month thereafter throughout the course of the case.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing scheduled for 04-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
